The World Health Organization and other reputable health agencies state there is no consistent association between Tylenol and autism, despite some studies raising concerns.
Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed a lawsuit against Johnson & Johnson and Kenvue, alleging deceptive marketing of Tylenol as the only safe painkiller for pregnant women.

entities: Andrew, Prince of Denmark (or Prince Andrew)

members.title: New photo released to mark King Charles III’s 77th birthday
key_points: The 77th birthday of King Charles III was marked by a new photo released from Sandringham Estate, showing him tending to a maple sapling in the gardens, emphasizing his connection to royal tradition and nature.

Charles’s birthday coincides with two traditional observances: a summer 'official' birthday with the Trooping the Colour parade and a winter birthday, a tradition dating back to King George II in 1748, highlighting the historical continuity of royal ceremonies.

The events on November 14, 2025, include a reception at Cyfarthfa Castle, where the King cut a cake shaped like the castle, and the official opening of the South Wales Metro Train Depot, showcasing his engagement with public service and modern infrastructure.

members.title: Some Korean Workers Detained in Georgia Immigration Raid Have Returned to Their Jobs at Hyundai Site
key_points: Over 300 South Korean nationals were detained in September 2025 during an immigration raid at Hyundai’s electric vehicle battery plant in Georgia, after being found to have expired or invalid work visas.

The workers, mostly engineers and skilled technical personnel, were detained at a $7.6 billion joint venture site operated by HL-GA Battery (Hyundai and LG Energy Solution), crucial for producing EV batteries.
The detention caused significant diplomatic tension between the US and South Korea, with South Korea demanding reforms to the visa system for skilled workers.

canonical_title: Justice Jackson goes ‘her own way’ in Supreme Court’s SNAP fight
entities: South Texas College of Law Houston
timeframes: Immediately after the appeals court decision..48 hours

members.title: Justice Jackson goes ‘her own way’ in Supreme Court’s SNAP fight
key_points: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, the least senior justice, granted a temporary administrative stay in the SNAP case, siding with President Donald Trump’s request to halt a lower court order that would have redirected $4 billion from another fund to pay full SNAP benefits.

This action, though initially controversial among liberals, included written explanation and a specific timeline, diverging from traditional boilerplate administrative stays and reflecting a more transparent and strategic use of the emergency docket.

Jackson’s decision was not a full court ruling, but rather a targeted administrative stay that allowed the case to be revisited quickly within her chambers, demonstrating a calculated effort to push the court toward a more principled resolution.

canonical_title: Judge says he'll approve opioid settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue and Sackler family

members.title: Judge says he'll approve opioid settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue and Sackler family
key_points: The U.S. Bankruptcy Court Judge Sean Lane has approved a $7 billion settlement agreement between Purdue Pharma and the Sackler family over opioid-related lawsuits, replacing a previous deal rejected by the U.S. Supreme Court.
The settlement includes $850 million for individual victims of opioid addiction, with over $100 million specifically allocated for children born with opioid withdrawal issues.
The Sackler family members are required to contribute up to $7 billion over 15 years and will forfeit ownership of Purdue Pharma, which will be renamed Knoa Pharma in 2026.

key_points: Iran is experiencing its sixth consecutive year of drought, with extreme heatwaves pushing temperatures above 50°C (122°F).
Only 2.3mm of precipitation was recorded by early November 2025—down 81% from historical averages—making it one of the driest periods in history.
19 dams, including the five major ones feeding Tehran (Lar, Latyan, Karaj, Taleqan, Mamloo), are at less than 5% capacity, with most below 10%.

members.title: Typhoon Fung-wong leaves Philippines with 10 dead, 1.4 million displaced
key_points: Typhoon Fung-wong (known as Super Typhoon Uwan in the Philippines) caused significant damage in the northern Philippines, killing at least 10 people and displacing over 1.4 million residents.
The typhoon resulted in flash floods, landslides, and structural collapses, with fatalities reported in Catanduanes, Eastern Samar, Nueva Vizcaya, Mountain Province, and Ifugao.
At least 4,100 houses were damaged, and over 240,000 people remained in evacuation centers after the storm passed.

canonical_title: The Trump Administration Plans Major Shift Away from Long-Term Housing for Homelessness
entities: Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

members.title: The Trump Administration Plans Major Shift Away from Long-Term Housing for Homelessness
key_points: The Trump administration is shifting federal homelessness funding away from long-term, permanent housing (the 'Housing First' model) toward transitional housing that mandates work, addiction treatment, and sobriety programs.

The policy change reflects a 2025 executive order signed by President Trump, which supports enforcement of homeless encampment bans and promotes mental health and addiction treatment as root causes of homelessness.

Overall funding increases from $3.6 billion to $3.9 billion, but the allocation shift risks putting up to 170,000 formerly housed individuals—especially seniors and people with disabilities—at risk of losing housing.

canonical_title: Scientists watch flare with 10 trillion suns’ light from massive black hole

members.title: Scientists watch flare with 10 trillion suns’ light from massive black hole
key_points: Scientists observed the most energetic flare ever recorded from a supermassive black hole, emitting light equivalent to 10 trillion suns.
The flare was triggered when a star between 30 and 200 times the mass of the sun wandered too close to a supermassive black hole and was shredded and stretched (spaghettified) by gravity.
The black hole is located about 11 billion light years from Earth and is roughly 300 million times the mass of the sun.

members.title: Examining Brown v. Board, race and ‘equal protection’ through the eyes of the modern Supreme Court
key_points: The Supreme Court has reinterpreted Brown v. Board of Education to promote a strict 'colorblind' standard, effectively rejecting race-conscious remedies that aim to address historical racial discrimination.
The conservative majority, led by Chief Justice John Roberts, has interpreted 'equal protection' as requiring elimination of all racial considerations, including in education and voting.
Civil rights advocates, including Sherrilyn Ifill and Jon Greenbaum, argue that this narrowing of Brown's legacy ignores structural racism and undermines progress toward true equality.

canonical_title: Appeals court declines to reinstate order finding ‘probable cause exists’ to hold Trump officials in criminal contempt

members.title: Appeals court declines to reinstate order finding ‘probable cause exists’ to hold Trump officials in criminal contempt
key_points: A divided federal appeals court declined to reinstate a lower court's finding that the Trump administration had probable cause for criminal contempt under the Alien Enemies Act.

Judge James Boasberg, an Obama appointee, ruled in April 2025 that the administration’s continued use of the law to deport Venezuelan gang members despite court orders demonstrated willful disregard, sufficient for probable cause of contempt.

The DNA analysis revealed a mutation in the PROK2 gene linked to Kallmann syndrome, a rare condition that can delay puberty and cause undescended testicles.
The study found no evidence of Jewish ancestry in Hitler, based on a DNA match with a known male relative of Hitler’s, thereby debunking a long-standing rumor.

canonical_title: Ammonia Gas Leak from Tanker Truck in Oklahoma Sickens Dozens and Forces Evacuations
timeframes: Wednesday night to early Thursday morning..4:16 AM EST, Fri November 14, 2025

members.title: Ammonia Gas Leak from Tanker Truck in Oklahoma Sickens Dozens and Forces Evacuations
key_points: An ammonia gas leak from a tanker truck in Weatherford, Oklahoma, resulted in the evacuation of hundreds of residents and treatment of 34 people at hospitals, with several in intensive care.

The leak originated from a faulty gasket or valve in a tanker truck carrying 25,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia, which is commonly used as a fertilizer but is highly toxic and can cause severe respiratory and skin injuries.

The incident prompted emergency evacuations, sheltering of at least 500 to 600 people, closure of schools, and evacuation of nursing homes, underscoring the public health risks posed by industrial chemical transport.

entities: European Society for Medical Oncology Congress
University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center

members.title: Could COVID-19 mRNA vaccines also fight cancer?
key_points: mRNA vaccines used for COVID-19 may enhance the immune system's ability to detect and attack cancer cells, particularly in patients with immunologically 'cold' tumors.
Patients who received mRNA vaccines before starting immunotherapy for cancer lived significantly longer, with survival rates nearly doubling in advanced lung cancer cases.

The study found that mRNA vaccines appear to 'wake up' the immune system, making it more likely to recognize tumors and activate T cells, especially in cases where tumors were previously invisible to immune surveillance.

Manuel Noriega, the former military dictator of Panama, is used as a historical parallel to Maduro due to their shared allegations of drug trafficking, authoritarian rule, and defiance of US authorities.
While Noriega initially considered exile and backed down under pressure, Maduro’s inner circle faces US indictments and million-dollar rewards, making a peaceful exit unlikely.

canonical_title: Invest in crypto? Here’s what to know about your 2025 taxes

members.title: Invest in crypto? Here’s what to know about your 2025 taxes
key_points: Investors on centralized exchanges will receive a Form 1099-DA in 2026 reporting gross proceeds from crypto sales, not cost basis.
Cost basis is not reported in 2025; investors must calculate it themselves to determine capital gains or losses.
Sales of stablecoins under $10,000, NFTs under $600, and wrapped tokens are not reported on 1099-DA, but still must be reported on the tax return.

canonical_title: Cleveland Pitcher Emmanuel Clase Pleads Not Guilty to Federal Charges Alleging He Rigged Pitches

members.title: Cleveland Pitcher Emmanuel Clase Pleads Not Guilty to Federal Charges Alleging He Rigged Pitches
key_points: Emmanuel Clase, a 27-year-old Cleveland Guardians pitcher, pleaded not guilty to federal charges of rigging pitches to help gamblers win bets, including a specific incident in April where a bettor won $11,000 on a pitch speed wager.

Clase and teammate Luis Ortiz are accused of accepting thousands of dollars in bribes from gamblers in the Dominican Republic to influence pitch outcomes, with Clase allegedly providing information on pitches and Ortiz being recruited to join the scheme.
The charges include wire fraud conspiracy, honest services wire fraud, money laundering, and conspiracy to influence sporting contests through bribery—each carrying up to 20 years in prison.

members.title: California revokes 17,000 commercial driver’s licenses for immigrants
key_points: California plans to revoke 17,000 commercial driver’s licenses issued to immigrants after discovering their expiration dates exceeded the legal status of the drivers in the U.S.

The revocation follows criticism from the Trump administration, particularly Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy, who accused California of issuing licenses to unauthorized individuals and claimed the state acted improperly.

California’s official statement clarified that all revoked licenses were issued in violation of state law, which requires license expiration dates to align with the end of a person’s legal status in the U.S.

canonical_title: Business jet that crashed in Michigan was flown after pilots chose not to wait for a test pilot, NTSB says

members.title: Business jet that crashed in Michigan was flown after pilots chose not to wait for a test pilot, NTSB says
key_points: The pilots of a Mexican-registered Raytheon Hawker 800XP business jet chose to perform a post-maintenance stall test themselves instead of hiring a test pilot, which contributed to the crash.
The crash occurred in Bath Township, Michigan, on October 16, 2025, killing three people, including two pilots and a maintenance representative.
The aircraft had been parked in Battle Creek for seven months for maintenance, including removal of part of the wing, requiring a stall test before service.

The comet passed within 29 million km of Mars in October 2025, and will be closest to Earth in December 2025 at 270 million km.

canonical_title: What’s behind a surge in bear attacks in Japan?

members.title: What’s behind a surge in bear attacks in Japan?
key_points: Bear attacks in Japan have surged since April 2025, with over 13 deaths and more than 100 injuries, the worst since 2006.

Both brown and Asiatic black bears are involved, with black bears more frequently attacking humans due to widespread distribution in densely populated areas like Honshu, while brown bears are more dangerous due to size and strength.
Food scarcity, especially due to low acorn and beech nut yields, is a primary driver of bears entering human settlements in search of food.

canonical_title: Federal Court Halts New Restrictions on Immigrant Commercial Driver Licenses

members.title: Federal Court Halts New Restrictions on Immigrant Commercial Driver Licenses
key_points: A federal appeals court in the District of Columbia temporarily blocked the Transportation Department’s new restrictions on immigrant commercial driver’s licenses, citing procedural flaws and lack of evidence linking immigrants to increased crash rates.

The rule would have limited commercial driver’s licenses to only three visa types: H-2a (agricultural), H-2b (non-agricultural), and E-2 (business investors), reducing eligible noncitizen drivers from 200,000 to just 10,000.
The court emphasized that immigrants with commercial licenses account for only 0.2% of fatal crashes despite representing 5% of all commercial licenses, undermining the safety argument for the rule.
